Description: Twelve fragments of a dark brown, undyed, well-spun, binding made of goat hair. The binding consists of 2 's'-spun, 'z'-plied elements. The binding elements are crimped in a pattern indicating they were formerly woven. A cotton fragment at one end is the only remaining weft element. The cotton consists of 2 'z'-spun elements that were 's'-plied.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 63)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.84C (excavation object cat. no.)
